amendment.description: To affirm that the United States may not engage in torture or cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment or punishment.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3386 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 3386 proposed by Senator Durbin. (consideration: CR S6784-6785; text: CR S6784-6785) To affirm that the United States may not engage in torture or cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment or punishment.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 3386 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3386 proposed by Senator Durbin.
